author: Staff Reporter
text:
The office-bearers of Joint Action Committee of Commercial Taxes Associations (JACCTA) have been organising protests here over problems they have been facing over the past few months in the department.

Their demands included publishing the rectified seniority list of all persons in service that was prepared and sent by the Principal Secretary and the Commissioner of Commercial Taxes to the government four months ago.

The government had given a commitment to rectifying the seniority issue by forming a committee that would look into this and publish a provisional list.

The protesting officers alleged that the department had given a commitment to publishing the rectified seniority list at least provisionally, but was now hesitating to do so due to an influential lobby by Group II officers.

They added that if this list was published, then more than 6,150 officers would get relief.
title: Tax officers stage stir to press for demands
